name: service
description: The details of the services provided by organizations to a range of different groups.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the service. Each service must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization that provides this service.

program_id.name: program_id
program_id.title: Program Identifier
program_id.description: The identifier of the program this service is delivered under.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The official or public name of the service.

alternate_name.name: alternate_name
alternate_name.title: Alternate Name
alternate_name.description: An (optional) alternative name for this service.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the service.
description.example: Counselling Services provided by trained professionals. Suitable for people with mental health conditions such as anxiety, depression, or eating disorders as well as people experiencing difficult life events and circumstances.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: An email address which can be used to contact the service provider.

status.name: status
status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the service which can be active, inactive, defunct, or temporarily closed.

interpretation_services.name: interpretation_services
interpretation_services.title: Interpretation Services
interpretation_services.description: A description of any interpretation services available for accessing this service.
interpretation_services.example: Interpretation services are available in Urdu, Polish, and Slovak

application_process.name: application_process
application_process.title: Application Process
application_process.description: A free text description of the steps needed to access this service.
application_process.example: If you are an NHS patient please ask your GP for a referral letter, we will then be in touch with you directly. If you are not an NHS patient you should ring our reception to arrange an appointment

fees_description.name: fees_description
fees_description.title: Fees Description
fees_description.description: A free text description of any charges for service users to access this service.
fees_description.example: Non-NHS patients are expected to pay for their counselling sessions. We charge a flat rate per hour of counselling. The current rate is £50 per hour. Please see our website for up to date prices.

wait_time.name: wait_time
wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: DEPRECATED: The time a client may expect to wait before receiving a service.

fees.name: fees
fees.title: Fees
fees.description: DEPRECATED: Details of any charges for service users to access this service.

accreditations.name: accreditations
accreditations.title: Accreditations
accreditations.description: A free text description of any accreditations. Accreditation is the formal evaluation of an organization or program against best practice standards set by an accrediting organization.
accreditations.example: All of our practitioners are accredited by the BASC, UKCP, and the Professional Standards Body

eligibility_description.name: eligibility_description
eligibility_description.title: Eligibility Description
eligibility_description.description: A free text description of the type of person for whom this service is intended.
eligibility_description.example: This service is intended for all people aged 12 and over who require counselling services in the MyCity area

minimum_age.name: minimum_age
minimum_age.title: Minimum Age
minimum_age.description: The minimum age of a person required to meet this eligibility requirement.

maximum_age.name: maximum_age
maximum_age.title: Maximum Age
maximum_age.description: The maximum age of a person required to meet this eligibility requirement.

assured_date.name: assured_date
assured_date.title: Assured Date
assured_date.description: The date that the information about the service was last checked.

assurer_email.name: assurer_email
assurer_email.title: Assurer Email
assurer_email.description: The contact e-mail address for the person or organization which last assured the service.

licenses.name: licenses
licenses.title: Licenses
licenses.description: DEPRECATED: An organization may have a license issued by a government entity to operate legally. A list of any such licenses can be provided here.

alert.name: alert
alert.title: Alert
alert.description: A description of any short term alerts concerning the service.
alert.example: Following COVID-19 we have moved most of our counselling sessions online. Please contact the reception if you require further information.

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

link_entity.name: link_entity
link_entity.title: Link Entity
link_entity.description: The table of the Link Identifier.

value.name: value
value.title: Value
value.description: The value (if any) of an attribute.

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_detail.name: taxonomy
taxonomy_detail.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy. Each entry must have a unique identifier

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the taxonomy from which terms are sourced.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the taxonomy.

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: A record of the changes that have been made to the data in order to maintain provenance information.

items.name: metadata
items.description: A record of the changes that have been made to the data in order to maintain provenance information.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this metadata. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

resource_id.name: resource_id
resource_id.title: Resource Identifier
resource_id.description: The identifier of the resource (service, program, location, address, or contact) that this metadata describes.

resource_type.name: resource_type
resource_type.title: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The type of entity being referenced.

last_action_date.name: last_action_date
last_action_date.title: Last Action Date
last_action_date.description: The date when data was changed.

last_action_type.name: last_action_type
last_action_type.title: Last Action Type
last_action_type.description: The kind of change made to the data.

field_name.name: field_name
field_name.title: Field Name
field_name.description: The name of field that has been modified.

previous_value.name: previous_value
previous_value.title: Previous Value
previous_value.description: The previous value of the field that has been modified.

replacement_value.name: replacement_value
replacement_value.title: Replacement Value
replacement_value.description: The new value of the field that has been modified.

updated_by.name: updated_by
updated_by.title: Updated By
updated_by.description: The name of the person who modified the field.

taxonomy_detail.title: Taxonomy

language.name: language
language.title: Language
language.description: An ISO 639-1, or ISO 639-2 [language code](available at http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php) to represent the language of the term. The three-letter codes from ISO 639-2 provide greater accuracy when describing variants of languages, which may be relevant to particular communities.

taxonomy_id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy containing the term.

schedules.name: schedules
schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

items.name: schedule
items.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the schedule. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD,

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.title: Valid To
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.title: Date Start
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.title: Until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurrence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.title: Count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.title: Week Start
wkst.description: iCal - The two-letter code for the day on which the week starts.

freq.name: freq
freq.title: Frequency
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats.

interval.name: interval
interval.title: Interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. For example, and Interval of 2 for a WEEKLY Frequency would represent fortnightly.

byday.name: byday
byday.title: By Day
byday.description: iCal - Comma separated days of the week. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.title: By Week Number
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric weeks of the year, where freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.title: By Month Day
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.title: By Year Day
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the availability of the service.
description.example: The service is available from 10 am to 6pm weekdays. The service is not available on public holidays.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.title: Opens At
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.title: Closes At
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.).

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.title: Schedule Link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the schedule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility.

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.title: Attending Type
attending_type.description: A free text description of how to attend this service.
attending_type.example: You can attend this service in-person or remotely via video conferencing

notes.name: notes
notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Free text notes on the schedule.
notes.example: Some of our staff will be unavailable during their lunch break which may be any 30 minute period between 1200 and 1400

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute

taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier

link_entity.title: Link Entity

taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

code.name: code
code.title: Code

name.name: name

parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_detail.name: taxonomy
taxonomy_detail.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken

id.title: Identifier

service_id.name: service_id

location_id.name: location_id

location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this service operates.

description.name: description
description.title: Description

contacts.title: Contacts

service_id.name: service_id

service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier

title.name: title

title.description: The job title of the contact.

department.name: department

department.description: The department that the contact is a part of.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the contact.

phones.name: phones

phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages

languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language

phone_id.name: phone_id

phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

schedules.name: schedules
schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

items.name: schedule
items.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the schedule. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD,

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.title: Valid To
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.title: Date Start
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.title: Until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurrence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.title: Count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.title: Week Start
wkst.description: iCal - The two-letter code for the day on which the week starts.

freq.name: freq
freq.title: Frequency
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats.

interval.name: interval
interval.title: Interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. For example, and Interval of 2 for a WEEKLY Frequency would represent fortnightly.

byday.name: byday
byday.title: By Day
byday.description: iCal - Comma separated days of the week. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.title: By Week Number
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric weeks of the year, where freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.title: By Month Day
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.title: By Year Day
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the availability of the service.
description.example: The service is available from 10 am to 6pm weekdays. The service is not available on public holidays.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.title: Opens At
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.title: Closes At
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.).

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.title: Schedule Link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the schedule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility.

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.title: Attending Type
attending_type.description: A free text description of how to attend this service.
attending_type.example: You can attend this service in-person or remotely via video conferencing

notes.name: notes
notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Free text notes on the schedule.
notes.example: Some of our staff will be unavailable during their lunch break which may be any 30 minute period between 1200 and 1400

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier

code.name: code

location.name: location
location.description: The details of the locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the location. Each location must have a unique identifier.

location_type.name: location_type
location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: The type of location, which may be either physical, postal, or virtual.

url.name: url
url.title: URL
url.description: If location_type is virtual, then this field represents the URL of a virtual location.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The organization identifier for a location. This is the organization that is responsible for maintaining information about this location. The identifier of the organization should be given here. Details of the services the organization delivers at this location should be provided in the services_at_location table.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the location.

alternate_name.name: alternate_name
alternate_name.title: Alternate Name
alternate_name.description: An (optional) alternative name of the location.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the location.
description.example: MyCity Civic Center is located on Main Street and contains facilities for a number of civic and community services available.

transportation.name: transportation
transportation.title: Transportation
transportation.description: A free text description of the access to public or private transportation to and from the location.
transportation.example: MyCity Civic Center is serviced by the number 1 Bus and is a short walk from the Main Street Metro Station

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

external_identifier.name: external_identifier
external_identifier.title: External Identifier
external_identifier.description: A third party identifier for the location, which can be drawn from other services e.g. UK UPRN or what3words.

external_identifier_type.name: external_identifier_type
external_identifier_type.title: External Identifier Type
external_identifier_type.description: The scheme used for the location's external_identifier e.g. UK UPRN or what3words.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

addresses.description: The addresses of locations where organizations operate.

items.name: address
items.description: The addresses of locations where organizations operate.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the postal address. Each postal address must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for this postal address.

attention.title: Attention

contacts.name: contacts
contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

items.name: contact
items.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the contact. Each contact must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier for the location of the contact.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the contact.

title.name: title
title.title: Title
title.description: The job title of the contact.

department.name: department
department.title: Department
department.description: The department that the contact is a part of.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the contact.

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

link_entity.name: link_entity
link_entity.title: Link Entity
link_entity.description: The table of the Link Identifier.

value.name: value
value.title: Value
value.description: The value (if any) of an attribute.

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_detail.name: taxonomy
taxonomy_detail.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy. Each entry must have a unique identifier

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the taxonomy from which terms are sourced.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the taxonomy.

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note

schedules.name: schedules
schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

items.name: schedule
items.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the schedule. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD,

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.title: Valid To
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.title: Date Start
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.title: Until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurrence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.title: Count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.title: Week Start
wkst.description: iCal - The two-letter code for the day on which the week starts.

freq.name: freq
freq.title: Frequency
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats.

interval.name: interval
interval.title: Interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. For example, and Interval of 2 for a WEEKLY Frequency would represent fortnightly.

byday.name: byday
byday.title: By Day
byday.description: iCal - Comma separated days of the week. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.title: By Week Number
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric weeks of the year, where freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.title: By Month Day
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.title: By Year Day
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the availability of the service.
description.example: The service is available from 10 am to 6pm weekdays. The service is not available on public holidays.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.title: Opens At
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.title: Closes At
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.).

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.title: Schedule Link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the schedule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility.

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.title: Attending Type
attending_type.description: A free text description of how to attend this service.
attending_type.example: You can attend this service in-person or remotely via video conferencing

notes.name: notes
notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Free text notes on the schedule.
notes.example: Some of our staff will be unavailable during their lunch break which may be any 30 minute period between 1200 and 1400

organization.name: organization
organization.description: The details about each organization delivering services. Each service should be linked to the organization responsible for its delivery. One organization may deliver many services.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the organization. Each organization must have a unique identifier.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The official or public name of the organization.

alternate_name.name: alternate_name
alternate_name.title: Alternate Name
alternate_name.description: An (optional) alternative or commonly used name for the organization.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description containing a brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.
description.example: Example Org is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing services to qualified beneficiaries

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

website.name: website
website.title: Website
website.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

tax_status.name: tax_status
tax_status.title: Tax Status
tax_status.description: DEPRECATED: Government assigned tax designation for tax-exempt organizations.

tax_id.name: tax_id
tax_id.title: Tax Identifier
tax_id.description: DEPRECATED: A government issued identifier used for the purpose of tax administration.

year_incorporated.name: year_incorporated
year_incorporated.title: Year Incorporated
year_incorporated.description: The year in which the organization was legally formed.

legal_status.name: legal_status
legal_status.title: Legal Status
legal_status.description: The legal conditions that an organization is operating under.

logo.name: logo
logo.title: Logo
logo.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

uri.name: uri
uri.title: URI
uri.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization such as those provided by Open Corporates or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the website field of the Organization.

parent_organization_id.name: parent_organization_id
parent_organization_id.title: Parent Organization Identifier
parent_organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization's parent organization.

funding.name: funding
funding.title: Funding
funding.description: The sources of funding for a service or organization.

items.name: funding
items.description: The sources of funding for a service or organization.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the funding. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization in receipt of this funding.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service in receipt of this funding.

source.name: source
source.title: Source
source.description: A free text description of the source of funds for this organization or service.
source.example: This service is funded partially by the MyCity local government and via grants made by charity funding bodies. We also operate a for-profit department which is used to partially cover the expense of the public service

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

link_entity.name: link_entity
link_entity.title: Link Entity
link_entity.description: The table of the Link Identifier.

value.name: value
value.title: Value
value.description: The value (if any) of an attribute.

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_detail.name: taxonomy
taxonomy_detail.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy. Each entry must have a unique identifier

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the taxonomy from which terms are sourced.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the taxonomy.

contacts.name: contacts
contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

items.name: contact
items.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the contact. Each contact must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier for the location of the contact.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the contact.

title.name: title
title.title: Title
title.description: The job title of the contact.

department.name: department
department.title: Department
department.description: The department that the contact is a part of.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the contact.

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

locations.name: locations
locations.title: Locations
locations.description: The details of the locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

items.name: location
items.description: The locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the location. Each location must have a unique identifier.

location_type.name: location_type
location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: The type of location, which may be either physical, postal, or virtual.

url.name: url
url.title: URL
url.description: If location_type is virtual, then this field represents the URL of a virtual location.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The organization identifier for a location. This is the organization that is responsible for maintaining information about this location. The identifier of the organization should be given here. Details of the services the organization delivers at this location should be provided in the services_at_location table.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the location.

alternate_name.name: alternate_name
alternate_name.title: Alternate Name
alternate_name.description: An (optional) alternative name of the location.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the location.
description.example: MyCity Civic Center is located on Main Street and contains facilities for a number of civic and community services available.

transportation.name: transportation
transportation.title: Transportation
transportation.description: A free text description of the access to public or private transportation to and from the location.
transportation.example: MyCity Civic Center is serviced by the number 1 Bus and is a short walk from the Main Street Metro Station

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

external_identifier.name: external_identifier
external_identifier.title: External Identifier
external_identifier.description: A third party identifier for the location, which can be drawn from other services e.g. UK UPRN or what3words.

external_identifier_type.name: external_identifier_type
external_identifier_type.title: External Identifier Type
external_identifier_type.description: The scheme used for the location's external_identifier e.g. UK UPRN or what3words.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the postal address. Each postal address must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for this postal address.

attention.name: attention
attention.title: Attention
attention.description: The name of the person or entity whose attention should be sought at the location. These are often included as a "care of" component of an address.

address_1.name: address_1
address_1.title: Address line 1
address_1.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

address_2.name: address_2
address_2.title: Address line 2
address_2.description: A second (additional) line of address information.

city.name: city
city.title: City
city.description: The city in which the address is located.

region.name: region
region.title: Region
region.description: The region in which the address is located (optional).

contacts.name: contacts
contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

items.name: contact
items.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the contact. Each contact must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier for the location of the contact.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the contact.

title.name: title
title.title: Title
title.description: The job title of the contact.

department.name: department
department.title: Department
department.description: The department that the contact is a part of.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the contact.

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available
