phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id

schedules.name: schedules
schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

items.name: schedule
items.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the schedule. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD,

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.title: Valid To
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.title: Date Start
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.title: Until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurrence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.title: Count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.title: Week Start
wkst.description: iCal - The two-letter code for the day on which the week starts.

freq.name: freq
freq.title: Frequency
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats.

interval.name: interval
interval.title: Interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. For example, and Interval of 2 for a WEEKLY Frequency would represent fortnightly.

byday.name: byday
byday.title: By Day
byday.description: iCal - Comma separated days of the week. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.title: By Week Number
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric weeks of the year, where freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.title: By Month Day
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.title: By Year Day
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the availability of the service.
description.example: The service is available from 10 am to 6pm weekdays. The service is not available on public holidays.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.title: Opens At
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.title: Closes At
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.).

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.title: Schedule Link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the schedule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility.

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.title: Attending Type
attending_type.description: A free text description of how to attend this service.
attending_type.example: You can attend this service in-person or remotely via video conferencing

notes.name: notes
notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Free text notes on the schedule.
notes.example: Some of our staff will be unavailable during their lunch break which may be any 30 minute period between 1200 and 1400

contacts.name: contacts
contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

items.name: contact
items.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the contact. Each contact must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier for the location of the contact.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the contact.

title.name: title
title.title: Title
title.description: The job title of the contact.

department.name: department
department.title: Department
department.description: The department that the contact is a part of.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the contact.

phones.name: phones
phones.title: Phones
phones.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

items.name: phone
items.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.title: Contact Identifier
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number.

type.name: type
type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
description.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

note.name: note
note.title: Note
note.description: A free text description of any additional context or services provided for this language.
note.example: Translation services provided via bilingual staff when they are available

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

link_entity.name: link_entity
link_entity.title: Link Entity
link_entity.description: The table of the Link Identifier.

value.name: value
value.title: Value
value.description: The value (if any) of an attribute.

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_detail.name: taxonomy
taxonomy_detail.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken

taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

code.name: code
code.title: Code
code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_detail.name: taxonomy
taxonomy_detail.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken
